page.title: 18Fishing:Evesbatch Court Farm
page.content: Mr. Porter's family started stocking their{lake}at Evesbatch Court Farm in 1970. It covers 3/4 acre. It was stocked with{coarse}fish, mainly carp. Later it was filled with different species, e.g.{roach}and{tench.}In 1982 they had 2" of rain in 20 minutes. Tgis totally destroyed the crops and killed the fish because the chemical sprays and debris were washed into the lake. He restocked the lake, but this cost him Â£10,000. He got some of his money back by selling day tickets for Â£2 and evening tickets for Â£1.25 for people's recreation. Every 4 years the{Severn {Trent Water Authority}nets the lake, taking out all the small carp and selling them to other lakes. Mr.Porter makes Â£2,000 a year profit; all he has to do is to check the drainage, spray the weeds once a year.
